answers.answer: Ya I had that issue. remember to eat something high in protein for breakfast (I used to drink protein shakes). Also let your doctor know it could be a blood pressure issue
I get dizzy and it's blood pressure for me. Make sure when you're changing position you do it slowly. Also make sure you're drinking plenty of water, because dehydration can also make you faint.
Sounds like you just need food or fluids
Okay thanks ladies. I'll be bringing it up to my doctor on our next appointment

Probably low blood sugar due to not eating for so long, and a lack of protien. You need to eat every two hours or so to keep your sugar and protien up or you could faint. I keep candy in my purse for when i get dizzy or tired like that and it works.
Probably low blood sugar but you need to contact the doctor. It could be preeclampsia

question: I'm 20 weeks pregnant and I just experienced severe dizziness, shakiness, and felt like I was going to faint. I expected it to go away in a few minutes but it lasted about 45 min. I don't know if it was because I hadn't eaten anything since breakfast or if it was something else. Have any of you mom's ever felt like that? And what does it mean?
title: What was this?!
